Kadang-kadang diturunkan hanya beberapa ayat pendek saja atau surah yang pendek pula dan kadang-kadang diturunkan ayat-ayat yang panjang sesuai dengan keperluan dan kebutuhan pada waktu itu.

Mengenai hal ini Allah berfirman:

Jangan engkau (Muhammad) gerakkan lidahmu (untuk membaca Al-Qur'an) karena hendak cepat-cepat (menguasai)nya. Sesungguhnya Kami yang akan mengumpulkannya (di dadamu) dan membacakannya.Apabila Kami telah selesai membacakannya maka ikutilah bacaannya itu. Kemudian sesungguhnya Kami yang akan menjelaskannya. (al-Qiyamah/75: 16-19)

Mengenai jaminan Allah dan terpeliharanya Al-Qur'an tersebut dalam ayat:

Sesungguhnya Kamilah yang menurunkan Al-Qur'an, dan pasti Kami (pula) yang memeliharanya. (al-hijr/15: 9)

Kemudian Allah menyuruh Nabi Muhammad saw agar berdoa supaya Dia memberikan kepadanya tambahan ilmu. Diriwayatkan oleh at-Tirmizi dari Abu Hurairah bahwa Rasulullah berdoa seperti berikut:

Ya Allah. Jadikanlah ilmu yang Engkau ajarkan kepadaku bermanfaat bagiku, ajarkanlah kepadaku ilmu yang berguna untukku dan berikanlah kepadaku tambahan ilmu. Segala puji bagi Allah atas segala hal, aku berlindung kepada Allah dari keadaan dan segala hal yang dilakukan oleh penghuni neraka. (at-Tirmidzi, Ibnu Majah dan al-Bazzar)
text.115: Pada ayat ini Allah telah menerangkan bahwa Dia telah mengamanatkan kepada Adam supaya selalu waspada terhadap Iblis yang merupakan musuhnya dan musuh istrinya Hawa. Memang Iblis telah memperdayakannya dengan bujuk rayunya dan mengatakan kepadanya bahwa pohon khuldi (keabadian) itu pohon yang paling baik, barang siapa memakan buahnya pastilah dia akan kekal di dalam surga. Karena keinginannya yang sangat agar dia kekal di dalam surga menikmati karunia Allah yang tiada putus-putusnya, maka Adam lupa akan amanat Allah dan larangan-Nya untuk tidak makan buah khuldi itu. Adam lupa bahwa Iblis itu musuhnya yang hendak menjerumuskannya ke lembah dosa. Adam lupa bahwa Allah melarangnya memakan buah yang dilarang itu sehingga dimakannya buah itu. Di sini tampak bahwa Adam yang sudah memiliki pengetahuan tentang niat buruk Iblis masih dapat diperdayakan dengan janji-janji yang menarik dikemukakan Iblis kepadanya apalagi manusia biasa, oleh sebab itu seseorang harus mempunyai kemauan yang kuat dan tekad yang membaja tidak akan dapat dipengaruhi oleh siapapun dan janji apapun, dia harus selalu ingat dan waspada dan mati-matian mempertahankan pendirian dan kepercayaannya agar tidak bisa digoda oleh Iblis.
text.116:
Sebagai penjelasan yang terperinci mengenai teperdayanya Adam oleh Iblis sehingga dia memakan buah yang dilarang memakannya. Allah menerangkan kisah tersebut sejak awal yaitu ketika Dia memerintahkan kepada malaikat supaya sujud kepada Adam. Dengan taat dan patuh malaikat pun sujud kepada-Nya tanpa membantah, tanpa rasa iri dalam hati, tak ada mempunyai perasaan sombong dan takabur tidak ada enggan sedikit pun melaksanakan perintah Tuhannya. Berlainan dengan Iblis yang sombong dan takabur, dia enggan dan tidak mau sujud kepada Adam karena menganggap dirinya lebih tinggi dan lebih mulia dari Adam. Mengapa mesti dia yang sujud kepada Adam padahal seharusnya Adamlah yang sujud kepadanya. Hal ini tersebut dalam firman Allah:

Lalu para malaikat itu bersujud semuanya. Kecuali Iblis; ia menyombongkan diri dan ia termasuk golongan yang kafir. (Allah) berfirman, "Wahai Iblis, apakah yang menghalangi kamu sujud kepada yang telah Aku ciptakan dengan kekuasaan-Ku. Apakah kamu menyombongkan diri atau kamu (merasa) termasuk golongan yang (lebih) tinggi?" (Iblis) berkata, "Aku lebih baik daripadanya, karena Engkau ciptakan aku dari api, sedangkan dia Engkau ciptakan dari tanah." (shad/38: 73-76)
text.117: Karena Iblis tidak mau sujud kepada Adam disebabkan kesombongannya dan iri hati atas kemuliaan dan kehormatan yang diberikan kepada Adam. Allah menegaskan kepadanya bahwa Iblis itu adalah musuhnya dan musuh istrinya. Oleh sebab itu ia harus berhati-hati dan waspada terhadap tindak tanduknya, janganlah sekali-kali ia mengikuti bujuk rayunya yang mungkin berupa nasehat atau anjuran. Tidak ada tujuannya kecuali menimpakan musibah atau malapetaka kepadanya. Jika ia teperdaya dengan mulut manisnya yang bila diikutinya mungkin akan menyebabkan Adam terusir dari surga yang penuh rahmat dan karunia-Nya. Bila hal ini terjadi tentulah Iblis akan tertawa gembira sedangkan Adam akan menderita kehidupan yang berat di dunia, di mana dia harus berjuang dan bekerja keras untuk kelangsungan hidupnya sedang di dalam surga dia hidup serba cukup tak ada kekurangan satu apapun, semua keinginannya dengan mudah tercapai dan terlaksana.
text.118:
Allah menjanjikan kepada Adam bahwa selama di dalam surga dia tidak akan merasa lapar dan haus karena berbagai macam makanan yang enak, minuman yang beragam serta buah-buahan selalu disediakan baginya. Dia tidak akan pernah merasa haus karena disediakan pula untuknya beraneka ragam minuman yang lezat dan tidak akan terkena sengatan matahari yang panas karena selalu berada di tempat yang teduh dengan angin yang menghembus sepoi-sepoi basah. Dia tidak akan telanjang karena Allah telah memberinya pakaian yang sangat bagus dan indah. Semua yang disenangi dan disukai dapat dinikmati dalam surga seperti dalam firman-Nya:

Kamilah pelindung-pelindungmu dalam kehidupan dunia dan akhirat; di dalamnya (surga) kamu memperoleh apa yang kamu inginkan dan memperoleh apa yang kamu minta. Sebagai penghormatan (bagimu) dari (Allah) Yang Maha Pengampun, Maha Penyayang. (Fushshilat/41: 31-32)

Dan firman-Nya:

Dan di dalam surga itu terdapat apa yang diingini oleh hati dan segala yang sedap (dipandang) mata. (az-Zukhruf/43: 71)
text.119: Setelah Iblis melihat bagaimana senangnya Adam dan istrinya di dalam surga menikmati berbagai macam anugerah Ilahi, timbul rasa iri dan dengki dalam hatinya dan dia ingin sekali agar nikmat dan karunia yang dilimpahkan Allah itu dengan segera tercabut dari keduanya. Dia melihat tak ada cara yang lebih tepat dan ampuh untuk mewujudkan keinginan itu selain menggoda keduanya, supaya memakan buah khuldi yang terlarang memakannya. Dengan demikian tentulah Allah akan murka kepada Adam dan mengusirnya dari surga karena telah melanggar perintah-Nya. Lalu Iblis mendatangi Adam berpura-pura sebagai sahabat yang setia yang selalu mementingkan kebaikan dan kebahagiaannya, dan berceritalah dia bahwa pohon khuldi itu adalah pohon yang istimewa, buahnya amat lezat sekali rasanya, tak ada buah-buahan di dalam surga yang lebih lezat dari khuldi itu. Barang siapa memakannya pastilah dia akan kekal hidup selama-lamanya dan kekal pula tinggal di dalam surga. Jika Adam ingin tetap selama-lamanya di dalam surga ini maka ia harus makan buah itu, niscaya ia akan kekal hidup selama-lamanya dalam surga yang tidak akan runtuh selama-lamanya.
text.120: Ayat ini menjelaskan keadaan Adam dan istrinya Hawa, ketika Iblis merayu mereka maka tanpa mengingat amanat Tuhan bahwa Iblis itu adalah musuh yang ingin mencelakakannya dan dia dilarang Allah memakan buah larangan itu, Adam dan Hawa memetik buah itu dan langsung memakannya dengan penuh harapan bahwa ia bersama istrinya akan hidup kekal di dalam surga. Tidak lama setelah Adam dan Hawa memakan buah larangan itu aurat mereka masing-masing terbuka, padahal sebelum memakan buah larangan itu tidak ada sedikit pun perhatian mereka terhadap aurat itu, lalu mereka merasa malu dan cepat-cepar memetik daun-daunan dalam surga untuk menutupinya. Sebagian ahli tafsir berpendapat bahwa akibat memakan buah khuldi timbullah pada Adam dan Hawa dorongan (insting) seksual, karena itu mereka merasa malu melihat aurat masing-masing. Demikianlah karena didorong oleh keinginan yang sangat, Adam lupa akan amanat Tuhan sampai ia melanggar perintah-Nya. Ia gagal menghadapi ujian Tuhannya, menjadi lemah tekad dan kemauannya disebabkan godaan Iblis dan disebabkan godaan nafsu dan keinginannya sendiri sehingga jatuh ke jurang pelanggaran.
text.121:
Setelah menyadari bahwa ia dan istrinya telah melanggar perintah Allah dengan memakan buah larangan itu ia pun menyesal atas keterlanjurannya itu, merasa kecewa karena membenarkan bujukan Iblis dan teperdaya dengan kata-kata manis dari musuhnya. Ia sangat khawatir terhadap nasibnya bersama istrinya karena telah mendurhakai Tuhannya. Ia merasa berdosa dan minta ampun atas kesalahannya itu seperti tersebut pada ayat:

Keduanya berkata, "Ya Tuhan kami, kami telah menzalimi diri kami sendiri. Jika Engkau tidak mengampuni kami dan memberi rahmat kepada kami, niscaya kami termasuk orang-orang yang rugi." (al-A'raf/7: 23)
text.122:
Tuhan Maha Pengasih lagi Maha Penyayang terhadap hamba-Nya apalagi terhadap orang yang diangkat menjadi khalifah di bumi, oleh sebab itu Allah tidak akan membalas keterlanjuran Adam memakan buah larangan itu dengan menimpakan siksaan atas dirinya, dalam keadaan lupa sehingga ia teperdaya dengan bujukan musuhnya, meskipun Adam telah melanggar larangan Tuhan yang telah memerintahkan supaya dia jangan sampai teperdaya oleh setan musuhnya itu, sehingga Adam dikeluarkan dari surga. Adam dan istrinya sangat menyesali perbuatannya dan telah bertobat meminta ampun kepada-Nya. Karena itu Allah mengampuni dosanya dan memilihnya menjadi orang yang dekat kepadanya. Akibat melanggar perintah Tuhan, Adam diperintahkan keluar dari surga dan turun ke bumi, dengan demikian ketetapan Allah bahwa Adam akan dijadikan Khalifah di muka bumi ini terlaksana, sebagaimana tersebut di dalam firman-Nya:

"Aku hendak menjadikan khalifah di bumi." (al-Baqarah/2: 30)
text.123:
Bukan saja Adam yang harus turun ke bumi tetapi Iblis musuh yang memperdayakannya harus turun pula ke dunia. Kedua jenis makhluk ini akan menjadi musuh satu sama lain, permusuhan Iblis terhadap manusia adalah permusuhan yang abadi dan berkesinambungan sampai datangnya hari Kiamat. Iblis akan selalu berusaha menyesatkan manusia dari jalan yang benar dengan berbagai macam tipu dayanya. Oleh sebab itu Allah mengingatkan kepada anak cucu Adam agar ia selalu waspada terhadap musuh utamanya itu. Apabila telah datang petunjuk dari Tuhan dengan perantaraan nabi dan rasul-Nya maka hendaklah manusia mengikuti petunjuk seperti yang diajarkan rasul. Dengan demikian dia tidak akan tersesat dan tidak akan celaka. Ibnu Abbas berkata mengenai ayat ini bahwa Allah melindungi orang-orang yang mengikuti ajaran Al-Qur'an dari kesesatan di dunia dan dari kecelakaan dan malapetaka di akhirat. 

Dari Ibnu Abbas r.a., Rasulullah bersabda, "Siapa yang mengikuti kitabullah, Allah akan memberikan petunjuk kepadanya untuk menghindari kesesatan di dunia dan memeliharanya dari keburukan hisab pada hari Kiamat." (Riwayat Ibnu Abi Syaibah dan ath-thabrani)
text.124:
Allah menerangkan bahwa orang-orang yang berpaling dari ajaran Al-Qur'an tidak mengindahkannya dan menentang petunjuk-petunjuk yang terdapat di dalamnya maka sebagai hukumannya dia akan selalu hidup dalam kesempitan dan kesulitan. Dia akan selalu bimbang dan gelisah walaupun dia memiliki kekayaan, pangkat dan kedudukan karena selalu diganggu oleh pikiran dan khayalan yang bukan-bukan mengenai kekayaan dan kedudukannya itu. Dia akan selalu dibayangi oleh momok kehilangan kesenangan yang telah dicapainya, sehingga ia melakukan tindakan-tindakan yang menimbulkan kebencian dan kerugian dalam masyarakatnya. Kemudian di akhirat nanti ia akan dikumpulkan Allah bersama manusia lain dalam keadaan buta mata hatinya. Sebagaimana dia di dunia selalu menolak petunjuk-petunjuk Allah yang terang benderang dan memicingkan matanya agar petunjuk itu jangan terlihat olehnya sehingga ia berlarut-larut dalam kesesatan, demikian pula di akhirat ia tidak dapat melihat suatu alasan pun untuk membela dirinya dari ketetapan Allah Yang Mahaadil. 

Sebagian ahli tafsir mengatakan bahwa orang yang berpaling dari ajaran Allah itu memang menjadi buta panca indera tidak melihat suatu apapun sebagai tambahan siksaan atasnya. Seseorang yang buta di kala terjadi huru-hara dan melapetaka akan lebih kalang-kabut pikirannya karena tidak tahu apa yang akan dibuat dan tidak tentu arah yang akan dituju untuk menyelamatkan dirinya karena tidak melihat dari mana datangnya bahaya yang mengancam. Tetapi sesudah itu matanya akan menjadi terang kembali karena melihat sendiri buku catatan amalnya dan bagaimana hebat dan dahsyatnya siksaan neraka sebagaimana tersebut dalam ayat:

Dan orang yang berdosa melihat neraka, lalu mereka menduga, bahwa mereka akan jatuh ke dalamnya, dan mereka tidak menemukan tempat berpaling darinya. (al-Kahf/18: 53)
text.125: Orang-orang yang kafir itu akan bertanya kepada Allah mengapa Engkau jadikan aku buta sedang mataku dahulu terang dapat melihat. Allah menjawab, bahwa hal itu memang demikian! Karena di dunia ketika datang kepadanya rasul-rasul membawa petunjuk-petunjuk-Nya dia berpaling darinya seakan-akan matanya telah buta dan seakan-akan ia telah melupakannya karena tidak mengindahkan dan memperhatikannya. Oleh sebab itu Allah jadikan mata hatinya buta pada hari Kiamat sehingga engkau tidak dapat mengemukakan suatu alasan untuk membela dirimu dari azab yang telah disediakan baginya sebagai balasan atas kebutaan mereka selama di dunia.
text.126: Orang-orang yang kafir itu akan bertanya kepada Allah mengapa Engkau jadikan aku buta sedang mataku dahulu terang dapat melihat. Allah menjawab, bahwa hal itu memang demikian! Karena di dunia ketika datang kepadanya rasul-rasul membawa petunjuk-petunjuk-Nya dia berpaling darinya seakan-akan matanya telah buta dan seakan-akan ia telah melupakannya karena tidak mengindahkan dan memperhatikannya. Oleh sebab itu Allah jadikan mata hatinya buta pada hari Kiamat sehingga engkau tidak dapat mengemukakan suatu alasan untuk membela dirimu dari azab yang telah disediakan baginya sebagai balasan atas kebutaan mereka selama di dunia.
text.127:
Demikianlah Allah membalas orang yang melampaui batas dan tidak percaya kepada bukti-bukti kekuasaan-Nya. Di dunia dia menemui berbagai kesulitan selalu bimbang dan gelisah, karena tidak ada pegangan dalam hidupnya kecuali kekayaan pangkat dan kedudukannya saja. Bila ia ditimpa suatu kesulitan atau marabahaya dia segera menjadi panik dan tidak tahu apa yang akan diperbuatnya dan kadang-kadang tanpa disadarinya ia melakukan sesuatu yang merugikan dirinya sendiri. Dia tidak pernah merasakan ketenteraman dan ketenangan hati. Ini berarti dia tidak pernah merasakan kebahagiaan yang hakiki. 

Di akhirat dia akan disiksa dengan berbagai siksaan di antaranya siksaan hati karena mata hatinya telah buta tidak dapat memberikan alasan atau hujjah-hujjah untuk membebaskan dirinya dari hukuman Allah atau dia memang dijadikan benar-benar buta matanya agar dia lebih tersiksa lagi karena tidak berdaya sama sekali untuk mengatasi suasana yang penuh huru-hara dan kedahsyatan. Sesungguhnya azab di akhirat jauh lebih berat dan dahsyat, terutama azab di neraka yang bersifat kekal selama-lamanya.
text.128:
Pada ayat-ayat ini Allah meminta perhatian orang-orang kafir agar mereka memikirkan dengan tenang bagaimana kesudahan umat-umat yang telah lalu, mereka telah dibinasakan oleh Allah karena kekafirannya dengan menurunkan berbagai macam malapetaka, ada yang berupa angin topan, gempa yang dahsyat dan ada pula yang berupa suara keras yang mengguntur. Mereka dapat melihat dengan mata kepala sendiri bekas-bekas yang ditinggalkan oleh umat-umat yang telah binasa itu. Bekas-bekas itu menunjukkan bahwa mereka adalah umat-umat yang kuat dan jaya pada masanya memiliki bangunan-bangunan yang besar dan kokoh, mempunyai kebudayaan yang tinggi lebih dari apa yang dimiliki orang-orang kafir Mekah. Tetapi karena keingkaran dan kedurhakaan, mereka dibinasakan Allah dengan sekejap mata, tak seorang pun yang selamat dari malapetaka itu. Yang dapat dilihat sekarang hanya puing-puing bekas istana dan benteng-benteng pertahanan mereka. 

Kaum musyrik Mekah dalam perjalanan dagang mereka di musim panas dan di musim dingin melalui bekas-bekas kerajaan yang telah runtuh itu, tetapi mereka tidak pernah memikirkan apa sebabnya maka kerajaan-kerajaan itu hancur dan musnah, dan menganggap hal itu adalah akibat bencana alam belaka. Seharusnya mereka dapat mengambil pelajaran dari umat-umat yang dahulu dan menginsafi bahwa bagaimanapun kuat dan jayanya satu umat, bila Allah menghendaki kehancuran mereka, karena kedurhakaan dan kekafiran tak ada yang dapat mempertahankan atau membela mereka. Mengapa hal ini semua tidak menjadi perhatian mereka. Sebenarnya kalau mereka mau berpikir, amat banyak pelajaran dan bukti-bukti kekuasaan Allah yang terdapat pada umat-umat yang telah hancur binasa itu, tetapi anehnya mereka tidak mengindahkannya.
text.129:
Kalau tidak karena rahmat dan kasih sayang Allah atau karena ketetapan yang telah diputuskan-Nya bahwa umat Muhammad saw yang ingkar tidak akan dihancurbinasakan seperti umat-umat dahulu itu, dan balasan atas kekafiran mereka ditangguhkan sampai hari Kiamat tentulah mereka telah mengalami kehancuran pula. Hal ini tersebut dalam firman-Nya:

Sebenarnya hari Kiamat itulah hari yang dijanjikan kepada mereka dan hari Kiamat itu lebih dahsyat dan lebih pahit. (al-Qamar/54: 46)

Para Ulama mengatakan bahwa hikmah penangguhan siksa umat Muhammad saw yang durhaka sampai hari Kiamat ialah memberi kesempatan bagi mereka untuk bertobat atau ada di antara keturunan mereka yang beriman. Hal itu merupakan suatu kehormatan dan kemuliaan bagi Nabi Muhammad saw dan rahmat serta kasih sayang Allah terhadap umatnya, dengan demikian pengikut-pengikut ajarannya akan bertambah banyak. Ini sesuai dengan harapan beliau sebagaimana disebutkan dalam sabdanya yang diriwayatkan oleh al-Bukhari dan Muslim dari Abi Hurairah:

Apa yang diberikan kepadaku adalah wahyu yang diwahyukan kepadaku oleh Allah. Maka aku berharap agar aku menjadi Nabi yang paling banyak pengikutnya di antara para Nabi. (Riwayat asy-Syaikhan)
text.130:
Kemudian Allah memerintahkan kepada Nabi Muhammad saw agar dia tetap bersabar menghadapi tindakan-tindakan kaumnya yang kafir itu serta cemoohan dan penghinaan mereka terhadapnya seperti menuduhnya sebagai tukang sihir, orang gila, penyair dan sebagainya. Di samping itu hendaklah dia senantiasa mengingat dan mensucikan Tuhan dengan bertasbih dan salat sebelum terbit matahari, sebelum terbenam matahari dan di tengah malam. Memang dengan mengingat Allah dan dengan salat seseorang dapat membebaskan dirinya dari kekalutan pikiran, kesedihan dan kebimbangan. Nabi Muhammad sendiri pernah berkata tentang faedah salat untuk menenteramkan hatinya.

Dan dijadikan ketenangan hatiku ketika salat. (Riwayat Ahmad dan an-Nasai dari al-Mugirah)

Pada ayat lain Allah memerintahkan untuk menanggulangi suatu masalah yang pelik hendaknya kita bersikap sabar dan mendirikan salat.

Dan mintalah pertolongan (kepada Allah) dengan sabar dan salat. Dan (salat) itu sungguh berat, kecuali bagi orang-orang yang khusyuk. (al- Baqarah/2: 45)

Dalam sebuah hadis yang diriwayatkan oleh Ibnu Jarir, Rasulullah saw bersabda:

Bersabdalah Rasulullah saw: "Sesungguhnya kamu akan melihat Tuhanmu sebagaimana kamu melihat bulan ini, kamu tidak dihalang-halangi waktu melihat-Nya. Jika kamu sanggup berusaha agar kamu jangan ketinggalan salat sebelum terbit matahari dan sebelum terbenamnya, maka kerjakanlah." (Riwayat al-Bukhari dan Muslim)

Kemudian Nabi membaca ayat 130 ini. 

Diriwayatkan dari Abu Hurairah. Bersabda Nabi Muhammad saw, "Allah berfirman, Hai anak Adam gunakanlah waktumu untuk beribadah kepadaKu, maka Aku akan mengisi dadamu dengan kekayaan (batin) dan menghapus kefakiranmu. Tetapi bila kamu tidak mau mengerjakannya maka Aku akan mengisi dadamu dengan kesibukan dan tidak akan menutupi kefakiranmu." (Riwayat Ahmad dan at-Tirmidzi)

Kemudian Allah mengatakan kepada Nabi Muhammad saw bila engkau telah mengerjakan apa yang telah Aku perintahkan kepadamu yaitu salat sebelum matahari terbit, sebelum terbenamnya, dan di tengah-tengah malam, niscaya jiwamu akan damai dan tenteram, dan engkau akan rida terhadap apa yang dikaruniakan Allah kepadamu sebagaimana tersebut dalam ayat:

Dan sungguh, kelak Tuhanmu pasti memberikan karunia-Nya kepadamu, sehingga engkau menjadi puas. (adh-dhuha/93: 5)

Mengenai rida dan kepuasan batin ini, sebuah hadis sahih mengungkapkan sebagai berikut:

Rasulullah saw bersabda, "Allah berkata kepada penghuni surga, Hai para penghuni surga. Mereka menjawab, Kami siap mendengarkan firman Engkau Ya Tuhan kami, selamat dan bahagia atas Engkau, lalu Allah berfirman apakah kamu telah rida dan puas? Mereka menjawab: Bagaimana kami tidak akan rida dan puas Engkau telah menganugerahkan kepada kami nikmat-nikmat yang tidak Engkau berikan kepada selain kami di antara makhluk-makhluk Engkau. Maka Allah berfirman, Aku akan menganugerahkan kepadamu sesuatu yang lebih baik dari itu. Mereka bertanya: Apakah itu ya Tuhan kami, yang lebih baik dari anugerah yang telah kami terima? Allah berfirman, Allah berfirman, Aku akan memberikan kepada kamu keridaanKu, maka Aku tidak akan marah kepadamu setelah itu untuk selama-lamanya." (Riwayat al-Bukhari dan Muslim dari Abu Hurairah)

Demikianlah halnya bila seseorang yang telah mencapai rida Allah berkat ketaatan dan kepatuhannya, terhadap Tuhannya.
text.131:
Ayat ini menjelaskan bahwa untuk menguatkan hati Rasulullah dan meneguhkan pendiriannya dalam menghadapi perjuangan menegakkan kalimah Allah, Allah mengamanatkan kepadanya agar dia jangan mengalihkan perhatiannya kepada kesenangan, kemewahan dan kekayaan yang dinikmati oleh sebagian orang kafir karena hal itu akan melemahkan semangatnya bila matanya telah disilaukan oleh kilauan perhiasan dunia dan ingin mempunyai apa yang dimiliki orang-orang kaya. Semua nikmat yang diberikan kepada orang-orang kafir hanyalah sementara, ibarat bunga yang sedang berkembang, tetapi tak lama kemudian bunga yang harum semerbak itu akan layu dan berguguran daunnya satu persatu dan hilanglah segala keindahan dan daya tariknya. Nikmat kekayaan yang diberikan kepada orang-orang kafir itu hanyalah buat sementara saja sebagai ujian bagi mereka, apakah dengan nikmat Tuhan itu mereka akan bersyukur kepada-Nya dengan beriman dan mempergunakannya untuk mencapai keridaan-Nya ataukah mereka akan tetap kafir dan bertambah tenggelam dalam kesesatan, sehingga harta benda itu menjadi sebab kecelakaan mereka sendiri. Allah telah menganugerahkan kepada Nabi sebagai ganti nikmat lahiriyah itu nikmat yang lebih baik yaitu ketenangan hati dan kebahagiaan yang berupa keridaan Ilahi.

Diriwayatkan oleh Abu Rafi', seorang tamu datang mengunjungi Rasulullah, sedang di rumahnya tidak ada yang patut disuguhkan kepada tamu itu. Rasulullah menyuruh saya meminjam sedikit tepung gandum kepada orang Yahudi dan akan dibayar nanti pada bulan Rajab. Orang Yahudi itu tidak mau meminjamkan kecuali dengan jaminan. Aku kembali kepada Rasulullah memberitakan hal itu. Rasulullah berkata:

"Demi Allah, saya adalah orang yang dapat dipercaya di antara penghuni langit dan orang yang dapat dipercaya di antara penghuni bumi. Seandainya ia meminjami atau menjual padaku, tentu aku membayarnya. Bawalah baju perangku ini. (Riwayat al-Bazzar). 

Kemudian turunlah ayat ini (thaha/20: 131).
text.132:
Ayat ini menjelaskan amanat berikutnya yang tidak kurang pen-tingnya dari perintah sebelumnya ialah perintah Allah kepada Nabi saw menyuruh untuk keluarganya mengerjakan salat dan sabar dalam melaksanakan salat dengan menjaga waktu dan kesinambungannya. Perintah itu diiringi dengan perintah yang kedua yaitu dengan peringatan bahwa Allah tidak minta rezeki kepada Nabi, sebaliknya Allah yang akan memberi rezeki kepadanya, sehingga Nabi tidak perlu memikirkan soal rezeki keluarganya. Oleh sebab itu keluarganya agar jangan terpengaruh atau menjadi silau matanya melihat kekayaan dan kenikmatan yang dimiliki oleh istri-istri orang kafir itu. Demikianlah amanat Allah kepada Rasul-Nya sebagai bekal untuk menghadapi perjuangan berat, yang patut menjadi contoh teladan bagi setiap pejuang yang ingin menegakkan kebenaran di muka bumi. Mereka harus lebih dahulu menjalin hubungan yang erat dengan Khaliknya yaitu dengan tetap mengerjakan salat dan memperkokoh batinnya dengan sifat tabah dan sabar. Di samping itu haruslah seisi rumah tangganya mempunyai sifat seperti yang dimilikinya. Dengan demikian ia akan tabah berjuang tidak diombangambingkan oleh perhiasan kehidupan dunia seperti kekayaan, pangkat dan kedudukan. 

Amanat-amanat inilah yang dipraktekkan oleh Rasulullah saw dan para sahabatnya sehingga mereka benar-benar sukses dalam perjuangan mereka sehingga dalam masa kurang lebih 23 tahun saja Islam telah berkembang dengan pesatnya di seluruh jazirah Arab dan jadilah kalimah Allah kalimah yang paling tinggi dan mulia.

Jika Rasul dan keluarganya menghadapi berbagai kesuliltan, beliau mengajak keluarganya untuk salat, sebagaimana diriwayatkan dari sabit, ia berkata : 

Apabila keluarga Nabi ditimpa kesusahan, beliau memerintahkan mereka, "Ayo salatlah, salatlah," sabit berkata, "Para nabi jika tertimpa kesusahan mereka segera menunaikan salat." (Riwayat Ibnu Abi hatim)
text.133:
Orang-orang kafir Mekah mencemoohkan Nabi Muhammad saw dengan mengatakan bahwa seruannya kepada agama yang dibawanya adalah omong kosong belaka. Kalau agama yang dibawanya benar tentulah dia membuktikannya dengan mukjizat-mukjizat seperti yang diberikan kepada Nabi Saleh yaitu unta betina, yang diberikan kepada Nabi Musa seperti tongkat dan yang diberikan kepada Isa yaitu menghidupkan orang mati dan menyembuhkan penyakit sopak. Andaikata ada pada diri mereka sedikit saja kemauan untuk berpikir dan kecenderungan untuk menerima kebenaran tentulah mereka tidak akan mengucapkan kata-kata yang demikian, karena Al-Qur'an sendiri yang diturunkan kepada Nabi Muhammad adalah mukjizatnya yang paling besar di antara mukjizat-mukjizat yang diberikan kepada Nabi-nabi sebelum Nabi Muhammad saw. 

Berbagai bukti telah menunjukkan bahwa mereka tidak dapat meniru keindahan susunan kalimat dan kosakata Al-Qur'an, mereka juga tidak dapat mendatangkan satu Surah pendek pun yang setaraf balagah dan fashahah-nya dengan Surah-surah dalam Al-Qur'an. Bukankah di dalam Al-Qur'an terdapat kisah-kisah mengenai umat-umat yang terdahulu sedangkan Nabi Muhammad sendiri tidak mengenal kisah-kisah itu sebelumnya. Bukankah di dalam Al-Qur'an terdapat syariat-syariat dan peraturan-peraturan yang maksud dan tujuannya sama dengan syariat yang dibawa Nabi-nabi sebelumnya yaitu syariat-syariat untuk kepentingan dan kebahagiaan manusia di dunia dan di akhirat. Sebenarnya Al-Qur'an itu saja sudah cukup menjadi bukti bagi kebenaran Muhammad saw dan sudah cukup sebagai mukjizat besar yang kekal dan abadi. Allah sangat menyesalkan sikap mereka yang menolak Al-Qur'an begitu saja tanpa alasan yang benar dan tidak mau memikirkannya walau sedikit pun. Pada ayat lain Allah berfirman pula:

Sebenarnya, (Al-Qur'an) itu adalah ayat-ayat yang jelas di dalam dada orang-orang yang berilmu. Hanya orang-orang yang zalim yang mengingkari ayat-ayat Kami. Dan mereka (orang-orang kafir Mekah) berkata, "Mengapa tidak diturunkan mukjizat-mukjizat dari Tuhannya?" Katakanlah (Muhammad), "Mukjizat-mukjizat itu terserah kepada Allah. Aku hanya seorang pemberi peringatan yang jelas." Apakah tidak cukup bagi mereka bahwa Kami telah menurunkan kepadamu Kitab (Al-Qur'an) yang dibacakan kepada mereka? Sungguh, dalam (Al-Qur'an) itu terdapat rahmat yang besar dan pelajaran bagi orang-orang yang beriman. (al-'Ankabut/29: 49-51)
text.134: Ayat ini menerangkan bahwa andaikata Allah membinasakan mereka sebelum mengutus Nabi Muhammad kepada mereka, mereka akan mengatakan pada hari Kiamat, bahwa Allah tidak mengutus kepada mereka seorang rasul yang akan diikuti ajaran-ajarannya sehingga mereka menjadi orang-orang yang beriman sebelum menemui hari perhitungan ini. Oleh sebab itu Allah tidak membinasakan mereka seperti umat-umat yang dahulu agar tidak ada alasan bagi mereka ketika menghadapi hari Perhitungan pada hari Kiamat. Karena Allah telah mengutus kepada mereka rasul yang akan menerangkan kepada mereka ayat-ayat Allah. Kemudian terserah kepada mereka apakah mereka akan mengikuti petunjuk-petunjuk Allah ataukah mereka akan tetap dalam kekafiran dan selalu menghina dan memperolok-olokan Muhammad saw.
text.135:
Pada ayat ini Allah memerintahkan kepada Nabi Muhammad saw agar mengatakan kepada orang kafir Mekah sebagai jawaban atas berbagai alasan dan cemoohan mereka terhadapnya. Kalau seandainya mereka tidak mau menerima petunjuk Allah dan tetap ingkar dan durhaka, maka Rasulullah bersama mereka menunggu keputusan Allah pada hari Kiamat. Tentu mereka akan mengetahui siapa yang berada di jalan yang benar dan yang mendapat petunjuk. Mereka akan mengetahui bahwa merekalah yang sesat dan akan dilemparkan ke neraka Jahanam. Hal ini tersebut dalam firman Allah:

Dan kelak mereka akan mengetahui pada saat mereka melihat azab, siapa yang paling sesat jalannya. (al-Furqan/25: 42)

Dan firman-Nya:

Kelak mereka akan mengetahui siapa yang sebenarnya sangat pendusta (dan) sombong itu. (al-Qamar/54: 26)

en.name: Ta-Ha
en.source: Aplikasi Quran Kementrian Agama Republik Indonesia

text.1: Ṭā Hā is among the *ḥurūf hijāʾiyyah* (letters of the alphabet) that appear at the beginning of several surahs of the Qur'an. The *Mufassirīn* (Quranic commentators) have differing opinions regarding the meaning of these letters. For further clarification, please refer back to the discussion at the beginning of Surah al-Baqarah in Volume I of "Al-Qur'an dan tafsirnya" (The Quran and its Interpretation) under the title "Fawātiḥus Suwar" (The Openings of the Surahs).
text.2:
In this verse, Allah explains that the Qur'an was not revealed to cause hardship and misery. For the Prophet Muhammad saw, this verse serves as comfort. It is emphasized that the Qur'an was not revealed to him to cause hardship, nor to be forced upon stubborn people, but the Qur'an was revealed to him to be conveyed to his people and to be a reminder to them about their misguided actions. If the Prophet Muhammad's duty has been carried out and his da'wah has been delivered, but his people still rebel and refuse to obey him, then it is left to Allah, because the Prophet's obligation is only to convey what is his duty, as Allah says:

"But if they turn away, then know that your duty (O Muhammad) is only to convey (the message) clearly." (an-Nahl/16: 82)

Therefore, the Prophet Muhammad does not need to feel anxious, let alone destroy himself because people do not want to follow his call, as Allah describes in His word:

"Then perhaps you (O Muhammad) would kill yourself through grief over them, [O Muhammad], if they do not believe in this message, [and] out of sorrow." (al-Kahf/18: 6)

Likewise, the Prophet Muhammad does not need to feel troubled in conveying the Qur'an to mankind, as Allah says:

"(This is) a Book revealed to you (O Muhammad), so let there not be in your breast distress therefrom - that you may warn thereby and as a reminder to the believers." (al-A'raf/7: 2)

Al-Qurthubi explains about the conversion of Umar bin al-Khaththab to Islam. At that time, Umar bin al-Khaththab entered the house of his brother-in-law, Sa'id bin Zaid, who was reading Surah Taha with his wife, Fatimah binti al-Khaththab (Umar's sister), and Umar asked for it but was not given it, so he became angry and snatched the manuscript. When Umar read it, his heart softened and became receptive to Islam.
text.3:
In this verse, Allah explains that the Qur'an was revealed to be a reminder and a lesson for mankind. Those who fear Allah will readily accept it and utilize the reminder and lesson for themselves. As for those who do not fear Allah, because their souls are frozen, possessing hearts as hard as stone or even harder, the reminder and lesson contained within the Qur'an will not leave the slightest impression on them. They are as if deaf, mute, and blind, without intellect, like other creatures. They will be cast into Hellfire in the Hereafter. As mentioned in Allah's words:

"And We have certainly created for Hell many of the jinn and mankind. They have hearts with which they do not understand, they have eyes with which they do not see, and they have ears with which they do not hear. They are like cattle; rather, they are [even] more astray. It is those who are the heedless." (al-A'raf/7: 179)
text.4: In this verse, Allah explains that the Qur'an brought by the Prophet Muhammad is from Allah, the Lord who created the universe, the Almighty over all that He wills. He is the One who created the earth and all that is in it. He is the One who created the vast heavens and all that they contain.
text.5:
In this verse, Allah explains that the Creator of the heavens and the earth is the Most Gracious, who is established on the 'Arsh (Throne). Allah is established on the 'Arsh, but it should never be imagined like a king sitting on his throne, because imagining it that way means likening the Creator to His creation. Such an assumption is not justified at all by Islamic teachings, in accordance with Allah's saying:

"There is nothing like unto Him, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing." (ash-Shura/42: 11)

Ibn Kathir said in his commentary that the best way to understand this verse is the way taken by the Salaf scholars, which is to believe the expression as stated, "established on the 'Arsh (sitting on the throne)," but the manner or *kaifiat* (how He sits on the throne) should not be equated with the way creatures sit, like someone sitting on a chair. That is entirely Allah's prerogative alone; humans cannot know its reality.
text.6:
In this verse, Allah explains that everything in the heavens, on earth, between the heavens and the earth, as well as everything within the soil, both known and unknown, belongs to Allah. He is the One who controls everything and manages it according to His will. He is the One who knows everything that exists, both the unseen and the seen. Nothing moves, remains still, changes, stays the same, or anything else, except with His permission, in accordance with His divine power and will (*kodrat iradat*-Nya). Allah says:

"To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Whether you show what is within yourselves or conceal it, Allah will bring you to account for it. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills, and Allah is over all things competent." (al-Baqarah/2: 284)
text.7:
This verse explains that when uttering prayers or remembrance (dhikr), it is not necessary to do so loudly. For Allah, it is the same whether it is with a loud voice or not. Allah knows what is kept secret, as well as what is more hidden than that secret, such as whispers of the heart, or something that crosses the mind. Prayers and remembrance are uttered with the tongue only to express what is in our hearts. Allah says:

"And conceal your speech or publicize it; indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts." (al-Mulk/67: 13)

In line with this verse, Allah says:

"And remember your Lord within yourself in humility and in fear and without loudness of speech in the mornings and afternoons and do not be among the heedless." (al-A'raf/7: 205)
text.8:
Allah, who revealed the Qur'an, is the Creator and Owner of this universe, therefore the truth of the Qur'an is beyond doubt. Allah is All-Powerful and the place where humans ask. To call upon Him, Allah has many names. All of these names are good, because they point to His perfection, might, and majesty. Nevertheless, His essence remains, unnumbered. In a mutawatir hadith, it is mentioned that Allah has 99 names. The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said:

"Indeed, Allah has 99 names, one hundred less one. Whoever memorizes them (and acts accordingly) will enter Paradise." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Abu Hurairah)

It is narrated that when Abu Jahal heard the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) in his call saying, "Ya Allah! Ya Rahman!" Abu Jahal said to Walid bin Mugirah, "Muhammad forbids us from calling upon other gods alongside Allah, yet he himself calls upon Allah alongside Ar-Rahman." Then the verse was revealed affirming that Allah has many names, as Allah says:

"Say, "Call upon Allah or call upon Ar-Rahman. Whichever [name] you call - to Him belong the best names (Asma'ul husna)." And do not raise your voice in prayer nor lower it, but seek a way in between." (al-Isra'/17: 110)
text.9: In this verse, Allah begins the story of Prophet Musa (peace be upon him) with an expression that seems to ask Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) whether the events and story of Prophet Musa when he preached to his people had reached him. This method is commonly used to focus attention, in this case, the attention of Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) and also his people on what will be conveyed. It has been the custom of the Arabs, when a piece of news or a story is about to be presented, to precede it with an expression in the form of a question, to attract attention so that the listener follows the news or story with full attention.
text.10:
After the agreement period ended, Moses herded the sheep of the Sheikh of Madyan, as the dowry that Moses had to pay to his father-in-law in Madyan. He asked permission to return to Egypt, to meet his mother who had been left for more than ten years. After receiving permission, Moses (peace be upon him) set off with his family towards Egypt, avoiding the usual road and taking a path along the slopes, fearing that his family would be disturbed by the king of Syria. In the tafsir of ar-Razi and al-Qurthubi, it is mentioned that after arriving in the Tuwa Valley west of Mount Sinai, his wife gave birth to a child, on a dark night, in cold weather and in a state of being lost. To warm the piercing cold, and to get light in the pitch-black atmosphere, Moses (peace be upon him) tried to get fire, but his efforts were unsuccessful. Then, unexpectedly, he saw a fire from afar on the left side of the road. So he said to his family with joy, "Stay here for a while, I see a fire from afar, and now I will go there. Hopefully, I can bring the fire here, or get guidance from it, to be able to get out of our lost path." This kind of event is also mentioned in another verse in the Qur'an, as Allah says:

"Then, when Moses had fulfilled the term, and was travelling with his family, he perceived a fire in the direction of the Mount. He said to his family: "Wait, I perceive a fire; perhaps I may bring to you from there some information, or a burning firebrand that you may warm yourselves." (al-Qashash/28: 29)
text.11: When Moses (peace be upon him) arrived at the place of the fire, he saw the fire shining pure white, encircling a green tree. Moses was astonished to see this event, because the pure white light of the fire did not diminish the green color of the tree, and conversely, the green color of the tree did not diminish the white light of the fire. At that moment, Moses (peace be upon him) heard a voice calling, "O Moses."
text.12: Hearing that call, Moses was surprised and hesitant, wondering where the voice was coming from. The call was then followed by a voice, declaring that Allah was the Lord who had created mankind perfectly. Then, the voice asked Moses to take off his sandals because he was in a valley called "thuwa," a sacred and highly respected valley.
text.13:
In this verse, Allah explains that He has chosen and appointed Musa (Moses) a.s. to be a prophet and messenger, and then he was asked to listen to the revelation that would be conveyed to him. In line with this verse is Allah's word:

"(Allah) said, "O Moses, I have chosen you above the people with My messages and My words. So take what I have given you and be among the grateful." (al-A'raf/7: 144)
text.14:
In this verse, Allah explains that the primary and conveyed revelation is that there is no true God but Allah, and there are no partners for Him. This is to instill a sense of *tauhid* (oneness of God), to single out Allah, to solidify recognition accompanied by conviction and proven by deeds. Therefore, He alone is the One who must be worshipped, and His rules obeyed. This *tauhid* is the essence of all essences, and this *tauhid* is also the first obligation and must be taught first to humans, before other religious lessons.

At the end of this verse, Allah emphasizes that *salat* (prayer) should be established. Of course, *salat* that is in accordance with His command, complete with its pillars and conditions, to remember Allah and pray to Him with full sincerity. *Salat* is mentioned here specifically, to show the virtue of the *salat* worship compared to other obligatory worships, such as fasting, *zakat* (almsgiving), *hajj* (pilgrimage) and others. One of the virtues of *salat* worship is that if it is carried out in the best possible way, according to the procedures that have been outlined for it, it will prevent a person from despicable and evil deeds, as Allah says:

Recite, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you of the Book and establish prayer. Indeed, prayer prohibits immorality and wrongdoing, and the remembrance of Allah is greater. And Allah knows that which you do. (al-'Ankabut/29: 45)

Some *Tafsir* (Quran commentary) scholars are of the opinion that the closing of this verse is addressed to people who do not perform *salat* on time, whether because of forgetfulness or other reasons, so that they perform it when they are aware and remember the command of Allah that was abandoned, as the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said:

Whoever sleeps through a *salat* or forgets it, then its compensation (*kafarat*) is to perform it when he remembers it. There is no other compensation besides that. (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Anas bin Malik)

And he also said:

If one of you sleeps so that he does not perform *salat* or forgets *salat*, then he should perform it when he remembers it, because Allah says, "And establish *salat* for My remembrance." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Anas)

One of the functions of *salat* is to remember Allah, but that does not mean that it is permissible not to perform *salat* and just remember Allah, because *zikr* (remembrance) is with the heart, tongue and limbs.
text.15:
In this verse, Allah explains that the Day of Judgment is certain to come, but Allah deliberately keeps its timing a secret and does not reveal when it will occur. Allah deliberately conceals the time of the Day of Judgment so that humans are always careful, vigilant, and prepared to face it. Concealing the arrival of the Day of Judgment is similar to concealing when a person's death will arrive. No human being knows when and where they will die, as Allah says:

And no soul knows in what land it will die. (Luqman/31: 34)

If someone knew when their death would arrive, they would certainly do as they pleased, follow their desires, and commit all kinds of sins they wanted. Only when their death was near would they repent, and Allah would accept their repentance according to His promise. Allah will not break His promise, as He says:

Indeed, Allah does not fail in His promise. (Ali Imran/3: 9)

But if they do not know when their death will arrive, they will certainly always be careful, fulfilling commands and avoiding prohibitions. If they commit sins, they will immediately repent for fear that their death will come suddenly before they repent. So, the purpose of keeping the Day of Judgment a secret is so that people are diligent in doing good. If people who should be doing good instead do evil, then it is very fitting that they be punished. Therefore, it is very just that those who do good are rewarded and those who do evil are punished. Allah says:

So whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it, And whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it. (az-Zalzalah/99: 7-8)

And His saying:

You are only being recompensed for what you used to do. (ath-Thur/52: 16)
text.16:
Even though this verse is addressed to the Prophet Musa (peace be upon him), it serves as a lesson for Muslims. Allah asks us not to be influenced by those who do not believe in the Day of Judgment and those who only follow their desires. If we follow the desires of those people, we will suffer loss and regret. Wealth and luxury will not be able to save us from Allah's punishment, as Allah says:

"And his wealth will not avail him when he perishes." (al-Lail/92: 11)

Likewise, our family will not be able to help us, as Allah says:

"On that Day a man will flee from his brother, and from his mother and his father, and from his wife and his children. For every man, that Day, will be a matter adequate for him." ('Abasa/80: 34-37)
text.17: In this verse, it is explained that Allah asked Prophet Musa (peace be upon him) what was in his right hand, even though Allah knew it; the intention was to explain that the wooden staff, which in essence had no significant meaning or many benefits, would be transformed by Him into an object with extraordinary advantages and great benefits that had never crossed his mind, namely as a miracle for him. The staff could become a large snake, and if struck against the sea, the sea would split, and if struck against a rock, the rock would gush forth water by the permission of Allah. These events demonstrate the perfection, power, and greatness of Allah.
text.18: In this verse, Allah explains the answer of Prophet Musa (peace be upon him) to His question, that, "The staff that he usually uses to lean on, when walking or tired, to shake down leaves for his goats to eat, and many other necessities, such as carrying provisions to ward off wild animals that would eat his goats." Musa's answer was eventually shortened by saying, "And there are other uses for me in it," because he hoped that his conversation with his Lord could last longer, and to maintain etiquette before God because of the possibility of other questions from God.
text.19: After Prophet Musa answered Allah's question about the function of the staff he was holding, including supporting his body, herding his livestock, and other functions that helped his daily work, Allah wanted to show Prophet Musa another function of his staff that he had never imagined. The staff would become a miracle that would prove his prophethood and help his function as a prophet. Allah commanded Prophet Musa to throw his staff.
text.20:
Once Moses fulfilled Allah's command, his staff transformed into a large, frightening serpent, slithering nimbly from one place to another, just like a small, agile snake. Seeing this reality, Prophet Moses was afraid and intended to flee, but due to the immense fear, he was rooted to the spot where he stood, as Allah says:

"And throw down your staff." But when he saw it writhing as if it were a snake, he turned in flight and did not look back. [Allah said], "O Moses, fear not. Indeed, before Me, the messengers do not fear." (an-Naml/27:10)
text.21: Because Moses was afraid, Allah commanded the Prophet Moses to seize the snake without hesitation or fear, because the large snake in front of him would be returned to its original form as a staff, as it was before.
text.22: In this verse, Allah commands Moses (peace be upon him) to insert his right hand from his sleeve and place it under his left armpit. Then, after he took his hand out, it would become pure white, radiant, and without any blemish whatsoever. This is the second miracle after the first miracle of transforming the staff into a swift snake, to demonstrate the truth of his prophethood to the people to whom he was sent.
text.23: Allah did all of that to show the proofs of the perfection of His power and the wonders of His deeds in the heavens and the earth.
text.24:
After Allah revealed the signs of His power and greatness, He then commanded Moses to go to the cruel Pharaoh and invite him to worship Allah, threatening him with wrath and punishment from Allah if he disobeyed, transgressed, was disobedient and arrogant, even daring to claim that he was God with his words, "I am your lord, most high."

It is narrated from Wahb bin Munabbih that after the command came, Moses remained silent for seven days, contemplating the weight of the task entrusted to him. After an angel came to him saying, "Obey your Lord according to His command," only then did he rise to carry out the command, hoping that Allah would expand his chest so that he could carry out his task well and bravely in facing Pharaoh. He felt that the burden placed upon him was a great and very heavy matter, which could not be carried out except with steadfast courage and an open heart. He was warned to face a king whose power was the greatest, the most cruel, very disbelieving, with a large army, a prosperous kingdom, and excessive in all things. The peak of his arrogance was that he did not recognize any god other than himself.
text.25:
Allah's command to Moses to face and meet Pharaoh was a very heavy task, therefore Moses prayed and pleaded to Allah to expand his chest and strengthen his mentality when he faced Pharaoh. Allah's word:

"And my breast constricts, and my tongue is not fluent, so send for Aaron." (ash-Shu'ara/26: 13)

In addition, he also pleaded to Allah to ease all his affairs, especially in conveying the news of his apostleship to Pharaoh, and to be given sufficient strength to be able to spread the religion and improve the condition of the people, because without the help and assistance of Allah, Moses would not be able to do anything.
text.26:
Allah's command to Moses to face and meet Pharaoh was a very heavy task, therefore Moses prayed and pleaded to Allah to expand his chest and strengthen his mentality when he faced Pharaoh. Allah's word:

"So my breast constricts and my tongue is not fluent, so send for Aaron." (ash-Shu'ara/26: 13)

In addition, he also asked Allah to ease all his affairs, especially in conveying the news of his apostleship to Pharaoh, and to be given sufficient strength to be able to spread the religion and improve the condition of the people, because without the help and assistance of Allah, Moses would not be able to do anything.
text.27:
Moses prayed that his tongue would be eloquent and not stammering, so that he could speak fluently and firmly, so that his words would be easily digested and understood by his listeners, so that they would obtain Allah's guidance. Because if Moses' tongue stammered, he would not be able to speak fluently.

The mufassir (Quran commentators) differ in opinion regarding the reason for Moses' lack of eloquence (stammering), as follows:

a. That when Moses was a child, he plucked a hair from Pharaoh's chin, which angered Pharaoh and he planned to vent his anger. Then he asked his wife to bring balah (unripe dates) and a lump of burning embers. Pharaoh's wife defended Moses by saying, "Moses is still a child, he doesn't know anything." Even though there was a defense, Pharaoh still carried out his evil intention, and the embers were placed on Moses' tongue. Since then, Moses' tongue became stiff. Therefore, Moses a.s. asked Allah to remove the stammer from his tongue.

b. His stammering was caused by psychological factors that burdened Moses, as a result of his actions and deeds of slapping and killing a Copt (Qibty).

c. According to another opinion, the stammering was congenital (present from birth).
text.28:
Moses prayed that his tongue would be eloquent and not stammering, so that he could speak fluently and firmly, so that his words would be easily digested and understood by his listeners, so that they might obtain Allah's guidance. Because if Moses' tongue stammered, he would not be able to speak fluently.

The mufassir (Quran commentators) differ in their opinions regarding the reason for Moses' lack of eloquence (stammering), as follows:

a. That when Moses was a child, he pulled a hair from Pharaoh's chin, which angered Pharaoh and he planned to vent his anger. Then he asked his wife to bring him *balah* (unripe dates) and a lump of burning coal. Pharaoh's wife defended Moses by saying, "Moses is still small, he doesn't know anything." Even though there was a defense, Pharaoh still carried out his evil intention, and the coal was placed on Moses' tongue. Since then, Moses' tongue became stiff. Therefore, Moses a.s. asked Allah to remove the stammer from his tongue.

b. That the stammer in his tongue was caused by psychological factors that burdened Moses, as a result of his actions and deeds of slapping and killing a Copt.

c. According to another opinion, the stammer was congenital, present from birth.
text.29: Because Musa felt that the task entrusted to him was quite large and heavy, he asked that Allah appoint a helper from his own family, to jointly facilitate the da'wah, sharing the same fate and burden in the joys and sorrows he would face from his people.
text.30:
This verse explains that Moses (peace be upon him) proposed that Aaron, his own older brother, be appointed as his assistant. Moses chose Aaron for several reasons, including Aaron's piety, his eloquent speech, and his Egyptian-like intonation, due to his frequent interaction with the Egyptians, the place for carrying out his da'wah (invitation to Islam) with Moses (peace be upon him). Moses' action is a good example to be followed, because a leader or ruler should have assistants to carry out his responsibilities, but of course, good assistants who can be relied upon for their good intentions in carrying out their duties as assistants. The Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) himself had assistants, as stated in his hadith:

"Indeed, I have two assistants in the heavens and two assistants on earth. As for my two assistants in the heavens, they are Gabriel and Michael, and my two assistants on earth are Abu Bakr and Umar." (Narrated by al-Hakim from Abi Sa'id)
text.31: Moses (Musa a.s.) pleaded to Allah, so that with the appointment of Aaron (Harun) as his helper, it was hoped that his strength and ability would increase. Also, so that Aaron would always be with him in all his affairs, working shoulder to shoulder in carrying out that heavy and sacred task, in order to succeed well, not miss the intended target, and achieve the cherished ideals well.
text.32: Moses (Musa a.s.) pleaded to Allah, so that with the appointment of Aaron (Harun) as his helper, his strength and ability would be increased. Also, so that Aaron would always be with him in all his affairs, working shoulder to shoulder in carrying out his heavy and sacred task, so that it would be successful, not miss the intended target, and the cherished ideals would be achieved well.
text.33: In these verses, Allah explains the background of Moses' (peace be upon him) request to always be accompanied and assisted by Aaron in successfully carrying out his prophetic mission. This was so that he could frequently glorify Allah, magnify and sanctify Him from attributes and actions that are not befitting of Him, such as Pharaoh's declaration of himself as a god. In addition to that, it was so that he would always remember Allah and constantly seek His pleasure.
text.34: In these verses, Allah explains the background of Moses' (peace be upon him) request to always be accompanied and assisted by Aaron in successfully carrying out his prophetic mission. This was so that he could frequently glorify Allah, magnify and sanctify Him from attributes and actions that are not befitting of Him, such as Pharaoh's declaration of himself as a god. In addition to that, it was so that he would always remember Allah and constantly seek His pleasure.
text.35: In this verse, Moses (peace be upon him) emphasizes that Allah knows best the reality and purpose of everything he asks of Him. He hopes that together with Aaron, the propagation of the religion can be carried out well, smoothly, and successfully, and that they can paralyze various efforts from those who are astray and lead others astray, and guide them to the right path.
text.36: In this verse, Allah explains that He has granted all of Musa's requests, namely that his chest be broadened, his affairs be made easy, the stiffness and impediment in his tongue be removed, and that his brother Harun be made an assistant for him, so that his strength and ability would increase, working shoulder to shoulder with Harun in carrying out his task. So that he would recite tasbih frequently and constantly remember and mention Allah (zikir). The six types of requests, as in the previous verse, were granted by Allah for the success of carrying out that heavy and difficult mandate.
text.37: This verse reveals that Allah had bestowed upon Moses several blessings without any prior request, long before Moses made the aforementioned requests. If Allah, in His generosity, had already given Moses many blessings since his childhood without any prior request, then surely, after Moses requested several things that were absolutely necessary to facilitate his path of da'wah, towards the goal he was aiming for, Allah would grant his requests. Eight favors were given to Moses since his childhood.
text.38: This verse reminds us that when Allah was about to bestow eight kinds of blessings upon the Prophet Musa (Moses), peace be upon him, Allah inspired Musa's mother, including informing and teaching her how to save her child from the tyranny of Pharaoh, who ordered his soldiers to kill all male babies under his rule.
text.39:
When Musa's mother was in a state of panic, she was commanded by Allah to place her child in a sturdy and well-made chest, and then cast it into the Nile River. Musa's mother immediately carried out this command, and eventually the chest fell into the hands of Pharaoh, the enemy of Allah and Musa's own future enemy.

It is narrated that one evening Pharaoh and his wife were relaxing on the banks of the Nile when suddenly they saw a chest not far from them. He ordered his maids to retrieve the chest and bring it before him. When the chest was opened, a handsome baby boy was revealed. How delighted Pharaoh's wife was to see the baby. Her affection and love for the baby were very deep. So she took the baby and cared for and raised him in her palace. This is the first blessing. The second blessing is that Allah bestowed sincere affection upon Musa and planted that love in the heart of every person. Whoever looked at Musa would feel affection for him. So it is no wonder that Pharaoh and his wife felt affection and love for Musa, so his wife said to her husband, as stated in the Qur'an:

"And the wife of Pharaoh said, "[He will be] an appeasement for me and for you. Do not kill him; perhaps he will benefit us, or we will adopt him as a son." And they were unaware." (al-Qashash/ 28: 9)

The third blessing is that Musa was raised in Pharaoh's palace under the supervision and observation of Allah, and protected from anything that would disturb him, while he was being raised by Pharaoh's family, cruel people who knew no humanity.
text.40:
When Moses was under the care of Pharaoh's family, they were busy looking for a woman to nurse him. Every woman who had been appointed to nurse him, Moses refused to suckle from. This is one of Allah's signs:

"And We had prevented him from nursing at [the breasts of] wet nurses before, so she said, 'Shall I direct you to a household that will be responsible for him for you while they are to him [in a position of] good will?'" (al-Qashash/28: 12)

Before they found a woman Moses would suckle from, Moses' sister Maryam came, having been instructed by her mother to secretly follow her younger brother's ark, and offered Pharaoh's family a woman who would nurse Moses and care for him, as narrated in Allah's word:

"Shall I direct you to a household that will be responsible for him for you while they are to him [in a position of] good will?" (al-Qashash/28: 12)

Maryam's offer was well received by Pharaoh's family, so his mother, Moses' own mother, was brought, and Moses suckled from his mother. Thus, Moses was returned to the care of his own mother, and his mother's anxiety and sorrow disappeared. How happy she was to see her son safe, healthy, and fit. This is the fourth blessing. The fifth blessing is when Moses entered the land of Manuf, Pharaoh's land, during a quiet afternoon when the residents were resting. He saw two men fighting, one from the Children of Israel, his group, and the other a Copt from Pharaoh's group, who was even Pharaoh's cook. When the Israelite asked for help, Moses punched the Israelite's opponent. Unexpectedly, as a result of Moses' punch, the Copt died. Because of this unintentional incident, Moses felt anxious and afraid, as narrated in Allah's word:

"And he became fearful within the city, anticipating." (al-Qashash/28: 18)

When Pharaoh learned of the incident, he was very angry and tried to kill Moses. Pharaoh's anger and evil intentions were reported to Moses by a member of Pharaoh's group who had believed in Moses, so Moses went away to the land of Madyan to escape. Thus, he was saved from Pharaoh's persecution. Moses was not only saved from persecution and murder in this world, but also saved from the torment of the Hereafter, because the sin of unintentional killing has been forgiven by Allah, upon his prayer, as narrated by Allah in His word:

He said, "My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, so forgive me," and He forgave him. Indeed, He is the Forgiving, the Merciful. (al-Qashash/28: 16)

Allah gave Moses repeated trials, to know the extent of Moses' mental endurance, as is common for someone who is being prepared to receive apostleship from Allah, but he was able to pass through them all safely, such as Moses being saved from the mass slaughter of babies on Pharaoh's orders, being saved when he was about to be killed by Pharaoh because he pulled Pharaoh's beard, Moses was defended by Pharaoh's wife on the grounds that he was still small, unable to distinguish between good and bad, so Pharaoh's anger subsided and Moses was saved from Pharaoh's murder and various other trials. This is the sixth blessing.

The seventh blessing is Moses' escape to Madyan, where he lived for a long time, approximately ten years. At first, he experienced a bitter life among the people of Madyan, feeling the pain of living as a newcomer who needed many things. Eventually, he was forced to become a laborer, herding his father-in-law's goats, to receive a modest reward to cover his needs, and was later married to Safura, the daughter of Sheikh Madyan. Thus, Moses, until he reached the age that had been determined, no more and no less, to be made a messenger, which was when he reached the age of forty.
text.41: The eighth favor is that Allah chose Moses to be a messenger, establishing proof of the truth he brought, leading mankind to *tawhid*, the oneness of Allah, and as an intermediary between the Creator and His creation, conveying His straight religion, which leads mankind to happiness in this world and the hereafter.
text.42:
This verse explains that Allah commanded Moses, along with his brother Aaron, to go to Pharaoh and his people, bringing with them the proofs and miracles that had been shown to him, such as the transformation of his staff into a large, agile snake, crawling here and there, and the emergence of Moses' hand from his armpit in a state of pure white, shining like the sun, without blemish, to be used as evidence and a reason for the truth of his prophethood.

In this verse, Allah also warns Moses and Aaron that in carrying out the da'wah and conveying the message of their Lord to Pharaoh and his people, they must be earnest and not negligent. Moses was commanded to explain to them that Allah sent them both to give good news of the reward that has been prepared for those who welcome his call, and to give a painful threat to those who rebel and refuse to accept it.
text.43:
This verse explains that Allah commanded Moses (peace be upon him) and Aaron (peace be upon him) to go to Pharaoh to present evidence of the truth of their prophethood bestowed by Allah, and to explain Pharaoh's error, because Pharaoh had gone too far in his actions, exceeding all bounds, to the point of claiming that he was a god. He declared to his people with the words, "I am your lord, most high."

This verse specifies the da'wah and call to Pharaoh, whereas in the previous verse the da'wah was proclaimed generally, because if Pharaoh had believed in the teachings brought by Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) and Prophet Aaron, then certainly all the people of Egypt would have followed him, as the saying goes:

'The people follow the religion of their king.'
text.44:
Allah taught Musa and Harun, peace be upon them, how to face Pharaoh, namely with gentle words and soft speech. Someone who is faced in such a way will be impressed in their heart and will tend to welcome and accept the da'wah and invitation proclaimed to them. This wise method has also been taught to the Prophet Muhammad by Allah, as His word states:

"Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good instruction, and argue with them in a way that is best." (an-Nahl/16: 125)

Conversely, if someone is faced with violence and shouting, let alone surrender and submit, they will instead oppose and distance themselves, as explained in Allah's word:

"And if you had been rude [in speech] and harsh in heart, they would have disbanded from about you." (Ali 'Imran/3: 159)

In addition to Allah's guidance to Musa and his brother, that they should be courteous in facing Pharaoh, they were also taught the words that Musa would convey to Pharaoh, as Allah narrates in His word:

"And say, 'Would you [be willing to] purify yourself, and that I guide you to your Lord so you might fear [Him]?'" (an-Nazi'at/79: 18-19)

With such methods and words, it is hoped that Pharaoh can realize his error and fear the torment that will be inflicted upon him if he continues to rebel.
text.45: Before Moses and Aaron (peace be upon them) carried out Allah's command to go to Pharaoh and deliver the call to him, they both frankly told Allah that they felt afraid and anxious about facing Pharaoh, lest they be tortured by Pharaoh, or before delivering the da'wah and explaining the miracles that demonstrated the truth of their da'wah, Pharaoh would act, uttering inappropriate words against Allah, because he was a cruel person, hard-hearted, and without any humanity whatsoever.
text.46: Allah comforted Musa and Harun (peace be upon them) so that they would not need to fear Pharaoh, because Allah would help them. He is the One who strengthens and protects them from the evil of Pharaoh. He constantly hears and sees what happens between them and Pharaoh, whether in the form of words or deeds. He is the One who will protect them both from the evil that Pharaoh might inflict upon them.
text.47:
Allah commanded Musa and Harun, peace be upon them, to go to Pharaoh and inform him that they were both Messengers of Allah sent to him to convey the true message, so that Pharaoh would know their position and duties. Before Musa and Harun invited Pharaoh to believe in Allah, they asked Pharaoh to free the Children of Israel from his torture and oppression, to free them from hard labor, such as digging, building, and lifting stones, both men and women. Pharaoh should allow the Children of Israel to go to Palestine.

Only after that would Musa and Harun, peace be upon them, explain the task and obligation from Allah, that they had come to explain the arguments and clear proofs of the truth of their prophethood. Happiness and prosperity in this world and the hereafter are for those who are obedient to the messengers of Allah, believe in His signs of power, and avoid evil and misleading things. Such words were also used by the Prophet Muhammad when sending a letter containing da'wah to Heraclius, the king of Rome, as follows:

"In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. From Muhammad, the servant and messenger of Allah, to Heraclius, the ruler of the Roman land. Peace be upon those who follow guidance. As for what follows, I invite you to Islam. Embrace Islam so that you may be safe, and Allah will give you a double reward." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Ibn 'Abbas)
text.48:
In this verse, Allah explains that it was revealed to Musa and Harun that punishment would be inflicted, both in this world and in the hereafter, upon those who deny the da'wah and call of the messengers who invite to tawhid, and who turn away and disregard the lessons and guidance of the messengers. In line with these verses, is the word of Allah:

"Then as for him who transgressed, And preferred the life of this world, Then indeed, Hellfire will be his refuge." (an-Nazi'at/79: 37-38 and 39)

And His word:

"So I have warned you of a Fire which is blazing. None will [enter to] burn therein except the most wretched one, Who denies and turns away." (al-Lail/92: 14-15 and 16)
text.49: It is narrated from Ibn 'Abbas that after Moses and Aaron (peace be upon them) arrived in front of Pharaoh's palace, they stood there, waiting for permission to enter. After being detained for quite some time, due to the very tight security, they were finally allowed to enter to meet Pharaoh; and a dialogue took place between them and Pharaoh. In this verse, Allah recounts that dialogue. Pharaoh asked, "If you two are truly messengers of your Lord who sent you here, I hope you will tell me, who is your Lord?" In this verse, it is as if Moses was the one being asked by Pharaoh, because only Moses' name was called, even though the question was addressed to both Moses and Aaron, because Moses was indeed the principal one, while Aaron was only an assistant to him.
text.50:
In this verse, Allah explains Moses' answer to Pharaoh's question, stating that the One who sent them both is the Lord who has completed the creation of His creatures with bodily members according to their respective needs, such as eyes for seeing, ears for hearing, as well as hands, feet, noses, and other bodily members according to their respective functions, in accordance with guidance from Allah. Allah states:

And Allah has brought you forth from the wombs of your mothers while you know nothing. And He gave you hearing, sight, and hearts that you might give thanks (to Allah). (an-Nahl/16: 78)

Then, it is Allah who guides by giving these members their function to be able to distinguish between what is good and what is bad. This is in line with the following verse.

Allah states:

By the soul and He who proportioned it, And inspired it [with discernment of] its wickedness and its righteousness, (asy-Syams/91: 7 and 8)

And His saying:

And We have shown him the two ways (of good and evil). (al-Balad/90: 10)
text.51: To divert Moses from his da'wah to another topic, Pharaoh asked him, "O Moses, what will be the fate in the Hereafter of the former nations such as the people of 'Ad, the people of Thamud who did not worship Allah, but they worshipped other than Allah. They had objects of worship such as inanimate objects like stones, trees, and others. Will they be admitted into Paradise or will they be admitted into Hell, punished and tormented?" Pharaoh deliberately did this so that Moses would stop presenting his arguments and other strong reasons that justified his da'wah, because Pharaoh was worried that Moses' da'wah would be accepted by his people, and they would believe in Moses and abandon their misguided belief that Pharaoh was god.
text.52:
Pharaoh's question was answered by Moses (peace be upon him) by stating that the question he posed concerned the unseen (ghaib), and indeed, no one knows the unseen except Allah, as affirmed in His word:

"He is Allah, other than whom there is no deity, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed." (al-Hashr/59: 22)

"[He is] Knower of the unseen, and He does not disclose His [knowledge of the] unseen to anyone." (al-Jin/72: 26)

The fate of the idolaters, the people who have objects of worship other than Allah, is entirely within the knowledge of Allah; no human being knows it. All human actions, including the fate of the people Pharaoh inquired about, have been recorded and compiled in a book, namely "Lauh Mahfudz" (the Preserved Tablet). Nothing is left out, neither small nor large, except that it is in that book, as explained in Allah's word:

"What kind of book is this that leaves nothing small or great unrecorded?" And they will find whatever they did present [before them]. (al-Kahf/18: 49)

Based on that record, they will be recompensed according to their deeds in this world. This verse is concluded with an affirmation that Allah will not err and will not forget, to prevent suspicions and unfounded accusations that the record in the book could be mistaken, incorrectly recorded, or that things were left out and not recorded by the authority due to forgetfulness, thus causing something to happen that is not in accordance with the actual reality.
text.53:
To reinforce that Allah will not err or forget, and to reject the possibility of suspicion arising that the records in "Lauh Mahfudz" could be wrong or that something might be unrecorded due to forgetfulness, this verse emphasizes that the Lord who controls the recording is the Lord who made the earth as a vast expanse for mankind, to be used as a place to live, build, sleep, and travel freely everywhere, as Allah says:

"Allah is the one who made the earth a place of settlement for you." (al-Mu'min/40: 64)

And His saying:

"He is the One who has made the earth subservient to you, so walk in its regions and eat of His provision." (al-Mulk/67: 15)

It is the Lord who has made roads on this earth, both in the mountains and in low places, to connect one place with another, one city with another, one village with another, to facilitate the fulfillment of human needs. In line with Allah's saying:

"And Allah has made the earth a spread for you, that you may walk along its spacious paths." (Nuh/71: 19-20)

And His saying:

"And We have placed within the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with them, and We made therein broad passes [as roads], that they may be guided." (al-Anbiya'/21: 31)

It is the Lord who sends down rain from the sky, which causes the growth of plants and fruits of various tastes, some sour, some sweet, of various kinds and types and benefits. Some are suitable for humans, and some are good for animals, all of which demonstrate the greatness of the grace and the abundance of blessings bestowed by Allah upon all His servants. In line with Allah's saying:

"He is the One who sends down rain from the sky, and with it brings forth fruits as provision for you." (al-Baqarah/2: 22)
text.54:
Allah commands that the various and diverse types of fruits and plants be eaten by us and given to animals to eat. Whatever is suitable for humans to eat, such as rice, sweet potatoes, corn, sago, and others, then eat it in accordance with Allah's word:

"And eat of what Allah has provided for you [which is] lawful and good." (al-Ma'idah/5: 88)

Whatever is suitable for animals, such as grass, is given to the animals. At the end of this verse, it is emphasized that all the aforementioned characteristics demonstrate Allah's power and the greatness of His kingdom, and are clear evidence of His oneness and indicate that there is no god but Him. People of sound intellect and rational minds will certainly acknowledge and believe in the oneness of Allah.
text.55:
In addition to the uses and benefits of the earth mentioned above, in this verse, Allah explains another use and benefit, which is that from the earth every human being is created by Allah, starting with Prophet Adam, the first human being in this world. Also, to the earth, humans will be returned after death, and become earth again as before creation. From it also, humans will be resurrected after death and their body parts, which have been destroyed and mixed with the earth, will be reassembled in their original form, and then their souls will be returned. In line with this verse, Allah says:

"(Allah) said, "There you will live, and there you will die, and from there you will be brought forth." (al-A'raf/7: 25)

In a hadith, it is explained as follows:

"Indeed, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) attended a funeral. After the deceased was buried, he took a handful of earth and threw it into the grave while saying "minha khalaqnakum" (from it We created you), then took another handful and said "fiha nu'idukum" (to it We return you), then took another for the third time and said "minha nukhrijukum taratan ukhra" (and from it We will bring you forth another time)." (Narrated by Ahmad and al-Hakim from Abu Umamah)

In another hadith, it is explained that after the body of Umm Kulthum, the daughter of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him), was placed in her grave, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said:

"From it (the earth) We created you, and to it We return you, and from it We will bring you forth once again in the name of Allah, and in the way of Allah, and upon the religion of the Messenger of Allah." (Narrated by Ahmad and al-Hakim from Abu Umamah)
text.56:
This verse explains that Allah has shown and introduced signs of His power and proofs of the truth of Musa's prophethood in the form of miracles that were given to Musa. However, Pharaoh and his followers remained in denial and rejected Musa, refusing to believe in what was conveyed to them, even though they had, in reality, believed in its truth, as Allah says:

"And they rejected them while their [inner] selves were convinced thereof, out of injustice and haughtiness." (an-Naml/27: 14)
text.57: This verse explains Pharaoh's method of denial and how Pharaoh denigrated Moses' efforts and work. Pharaoh said, "O Moses! Have you come here to the place where you once lived, after a long absence, with the intention of instilling in the public the understanding that you are a Prophet, and they are obligated to follow you and believe in the religion you bring, so that you are on the winning side, and then expel us from this place with your magic that you call a miracle, and you become powerful as a king?" Pharaoh deliberately uttered such words with the intention of inciting his people to anger and hatred towards Moses. He explained that Moses' arrival was not merely to save the Children of Israel from his power, but that his real intention was to expel the Egyptians from their homeland and then seize all their possessions. Thus, Moses' efforts would fail, because no one would listen to and pay attention to his da'wah, nor would they care about the miracle he brought. They would defend their country to the death, using all the strength at their disposal.
text.58: This verse explains that Pharaoh earnestly promised to bring magicians to compete with Moses' magic. Pharaoh asked Moses to determine the place and time to confront his magicians, and promised that neither he nor Moses would violate the agreed-upon stipulations. Pharaoh did this to show that he truly had a hardened heart and solid preparation to compete against Moses' magic, with the conviction that he would win the competition later. Pharaoh also suggested that Moses choose a spacious place, not hilly, so that the audience could witness and see the competition clearly, unhindered by anything.
text.59: This verse explains that, in accordance with Pharaoh's request, Moses set the time for the intended meeting to compete his miracles against Pharaoh's magic, which was on the day of Syam an-Nasim, usually held at the end of the year. On that day, they all gathered in fine clothes and beautiful decorations, with almost no one missing.
